results.title: Fear and Fantasy (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
A psychological study of anxiety and prejudice. Highlights how anxiety is the root source of many prejudices and how group training procedures can provide personal insight into problems.

results.title: Love Me Do (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
Examines the social psychology of relationships, considers how stable social relationships are vital to human beings and shows how social abilities greatly influence an individual’s health and happiness.

results.title: Solving linear equations with one variable
results.creator_credit: Mark M Williams, Bill Hanlon and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program introduces solving linear equations with one variable when the variable is a natural number. Students will be shown basic rules that will allow them to solve this type of equation. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark M Williams, Bill Hanlon and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)

results.title: Word problems 2: variables
results.creator_credit: Mark M Williams, Bill Hanlon and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program shows how to write word problems with two variables in a mathematical way and how then to solve these equations by linear combination or substitution. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program introduces the opposite concept of other programs in the “Algebra, you can do it” series and teaches students how to find the equation if something is known about the graph through a step by step exercises. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.

results.title: Graphing linear equations
results.creator_credit: Carla Cody Weaver, Bill Hanlon and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program shows how to graph a linear equation by finding the value for x and y. It also familiarises students with the correct vocabulary to use when describing linear equations. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.

results.title: Alexandria again and forever
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine, Le Sept, Paris Classics and Misr International Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alexandria Trilogy”.
In this third and final instalment of Youssef Chahine’s “Alexandria” trilogy (preceded by Alexandria, why? and An Egyptian story) Chahine’s protagonist and alter-ego, Yehia, is now an aging filmmaker who laments the state of the Egyptian film industry and joins his colleagues on strike to protest their circumstances. Simultaneously Yehia (played by the director himself) finds himself attracted to two actors - the handsome young Amr, who Yehia works with on laboured productions, and Nadia, with whom he hopes to collaborate. Following on from the themes explored in “An Egyptian story”, Yahia heartlessly forfeits his personal relationships in favour of his work. Yahine’s struggle to reconcile his art with his ambitions and personal failings is set against Egypt’s divisive drive, in the 1980s, toward democratic reform. The film takes on a surreal flavour with several musical interludes (one delightfully recalling “Singin’ in the rain” as Yehia and Amr celebrate winning the Silver Bear award at Berlin). Chahine applies his signature energy to the film - an appealing mix of whimsy, satire and barbed attacks on the political and social situation in his beloved homeland. In Arabic with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Youssef Chahine, Le Sept, Paris Classics and Misr International Films
